alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Clay (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 08 at 11:23AM EST until January 10 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM EST THIS EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of southwest North Carolina, including the following counties, Cherokee and Clay. * WHEN...From 7 PM EST this evening through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A strong area of low pressure will bring widespread rainfall to the area tonight and will continue through Tuesday. Rain will be heavy at times. Rainfall amounts of 2-3 inches are expected, but locally higher amounts will be possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
